name: aristida-stricta
country-or-region-of-origin: E. North Carolina to N. South Carolina
wildlife-value: Provides cover year round. Produces seeds eaten by quail and songbirds and provides cover for many birds, reptiles, and small mammals. White-tailed deer may browse foliage but this plant is highly resistant to damage.
particularly-resistant-to-insects/diseas: deer damage, salt. Heat and drought tolerant.
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
Partial Shade (Direct sunlight only part of the day, 2-6 hours)
fruit-description: The grass produces yellow seed. Fruit displays from November to December.
flower-description: Flowers are small and inconspicuous. They bloom from September to November.
leaf-description: The leaves are needle-like and have a white fuzz around the base.
